alert.note: Alert for Jackson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 13 at 8:58AM CDT until further notice by NWS Houston - Galveston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CDT TODAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following county, Jackson. * WHEN...Until noon CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 858 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to slow moving thunderstorms. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Rain rates between 1 and 2 inches of rain per hour have fallen. - Additional rainfall rates of 1 to 2 inches per hour are expected over the area from these slow moving storms. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Edna, La Ward, Lolita, Lake Texana Dam, Vanderbilt and Morales. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
